issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: Query with LEFT SEMI JOIN producing wrong result

ATTACHMENT ID: 12901424 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

[~vgarg], could you check {{rightAggregate.indicator}} check by {{rightAggregate.getType != GroupType.SIMPLE}}? {{indicator}} was deprecated recently.

Once that is solved, looks good. +1

[~vgarg], another quick comment before pushing it: could we add some data to the new test or modify the test so that it produces data (even if it is a few rows)? I think that will be important so we do not regress in the future.
Thanks for your comments [~jcamachorodriguez]. Just to confirm {{GroupType.SIMPLE}} should indicate that grouping sets is not present?

[~jcamachorodriguez] Actually this test helped us finding this bug, it wasn't suppose to produce any data but due to bug was producing data. So I think this test still has value. I'll see if I can add another test which produces data.

bq. Just to confirm GroupType.SIMPLE should indicate that grouping sets is not present?
Yes, exactly.

About the test, if that is the case, then it is fine. +1
